pros: For an EMT, they paid fantastically. Always paid on time, never any issues with payment.

review_title: Good Pay. Don’t recommend working during any pandemics
job_title: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) in Sacramento, CA
pros: Great Pay. Great opportunity to help during the pandemic. Great place to learn to be more: organized; punctual; troubleshoot; problem-solve; and develop team skills.
cons: Lack of communication from upper management. They have 1 person do the task of 3 people. You meet many “Karens” as patients. Definitely do not recommend anyone to work during a surge of any pandemic, especially if you are a soft and caring individual. Yes you want to help the public, but the burn out is real, esp after working long hours in bad weather, no lunch or breaks, and have half the patients mad that they waited for 2-3 hours before getting tested. Like sir/ma’am I have not eaten today, and I am sorry for you for having nice comfy car to wait for 2-3 hours, while I am outside in direct rain, soaking wet and trying to do covid test for past 12 hours since 7am, and now its 7pm…..

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Temecula, CA
pros: Work from home for all shifts.
cons: Poor communication. Poor leadership and terrible follow through from sites.

review_title: Overall good compensation, but bad work culture and management.
job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Easy tasks, good hours, good compensation. Hard to mess this job up- just swab patients, process tests, and input results. Out the door at 4-4:30.
cons: To start, my recruiter never put me in touch with my site manager, which made for a difficult, confusing start to the job. And, unfortunately, the management at the site seemed very unorganized and out of touch. We were asked to sign control test logs, but were not provided with actual control tests, which was confusing. They hired on 4 new people (myself included) around the same time and almost immediately fired us without providing reason. I worked for only 1 month and others less than a week. It seemed disrespectful of our time, like we were dispensable, and honestly like they didn't know what they were doing. Communication from management was poor- I was texted at 10pm informing me with less than one day's notice of my termination, rather than letting me know face to face that day at work. Overall, it was good just as a temporary gig, but felt like a waste of time.

job_title: Clerical Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Pay is ok. No growth will lay off.
cons: Literally Everything about the company.

job_title: Chief People Officer (CPO) in Huntington Beach, CA
pros: Incredible opportunity to help people through a very scary time in their lives and to learn about the medical profession for entry level job seekers.
cons: Not entirely stable as the need for employees ebbs and flows with the tide of the pandemic.

review_title: Profiteering from a Crisis! Shameful company
job_title: Clinical Assistant in San Francisco, CA
pros: they pay on time, you can do whatever you want in between rushes so bring a book.
cons: Pure nepotism: a bunch of rookie 23 year olds who promote each other to run sites, require a lot from you, stupid paper pushing and hoops to jump through but no one actually knows whats going on or checks on any of it. Then they'll lay you off after sacrificing your schedule for them (with no notice!). No regard for employees, treat you like children. Completely unprofessional, a corrupt company profiteering off of a crisis meanwhile being subsidized by the government. Shameful and a giant joke. If you do take the job negotiate the highest salary possible (they have the $ trust me) they don't give raises.

pros: The pay was steady. That was about it

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in San Diego, CA
pros: Great pay for EMTs, double what an ambulance company pays. Easy work, swab, test, repeat.
cons: Very poor "leadership," that doesn't look out for the customer or the employees. Operating hours constantly changing with only a day or so notice. Very short staffed, unable to take 10 minute mandatory breaks. Get in trouble if you miss a punch on your timecard.. and we use our own resources to do our timecard (own phone). Resources not provided by company for training (i.e. computer), uncompensated training taken by some employees, timecard manipulation by managers resulting in unpaid time, Customers yell at field staff that they can't get through to customer service for refund issues, and we cannot help, and leadership doesn't care to help, they just tell them to keep calling the number. It's very apparent this company is just in it for the money, they don't care about their people or their customer base.

pros: Good pay and easy job but don’t plan to make a career out of this
cons: Management sucks rude no communication not even a smile no help not good working conditions. No break room no accessible restroom
